Jonathan Harker.name: Jonathan Harker
Jonathan Harker.role: husband of Mina, recovering from illness, partner in firm with Mr. Hawkins, referenced in Mina's letter; Solicitor, husband of Mina, narrator of part of the journal, victim in stupor and ally against the Count

Mina Harker.name: Mina Harker
Mina Harker.role: assistant schoolmistress, fiancée of Jonathan Harker, writer of letters and journal entries

Count Dracula.name: Count Dracula
Count Dracula.role: nobleman from Transylvania, host to Jonathan, owner of Castle Dracula, appears as host and possibly the driver; Vampire antagonist, referred to as the enemy, controls animals, moves boxes, appears in dreams and visions

Peter Hawkins.name: Peter Hawkins
Peter Hawkins.role: Jonathan's employer, solicitor from Exeter, sends Jonathan on the business trip, author of the letter to Dracula

Attila.name: Attila
Attila.role: historical leader of the Huns, referenced as ancestor of the Szekelys

St. George.name: St. George
St. George.role: saint, referenced in the context of St. George’s Day and associated superstitions

Burger.name: Burger
Burger.role: poet, author of the poem 'Lenore', referenced in a whispered line from the poem

Lenore.name: Lenore
Lenore.role: literary character from Burger’s poem 'Lenore', referenced in the poem's title and quoted line

Lucy Westenra.name: Miss Lucy Westenra
Lucy Westenra.role: central character writing diary entries, patient suffering from mysterious illness, daughter of Mrs. Westenra, fiancée of Arthur; Deceased previous victim of the Count, referenced in comparison to his reactions

Arthur Holmwood.name: Hon. Arthur Holmwood
Arthur Holmwood.role: Lucy's fiancé, mentioned in diaries and telegrams, provides blood transfusion earlier, arrives to visit Lucy

Mrs. Westenra.name: Mrs. Westenra
Mrs. Westenra.role: Lucy's mother, suffers from heart disease, removes garlic flowers unknowingly, dies in the incident with the wolf; Mother of Lucy Westenra, mentioned in relation to not informing her about Lucy's sleep-walking

John Seward.name: Dr. John Seward
John Seward.role: doctor managing a lunatic asylum, suitor rejected by Lucy, keeper of phonograph diary, friend of Arthur and Quincey; Doctor and asylum director, narrator of the diary, involved in treating Renfield and confronting the Count

Quincey P. Morris.name: Quincey P. Morris
Quincey P. Morris.role: American from Texas, suitor rejected by Lucy, friend of Arthur and John Seward, writer of letter

R. M. Renfield.name: R. M. Renfield
R. M. Renfield.role: patient in Seward's asylum, has an outbreak, licks Seward's blood, mentioned in diary and report

Mr. Swales.name: Mr. Swales
Mr. Swales.role: elderly man nearly 100 years old, former sailor, skeptical storyteller in Whitby churchyard

Lord Godalming.name: Lord Godalming
Lord Godalming.role: father of Arthur Holmwood, seriously ill; Nobleman, part of the hunting group, formerly Honourable Arthur Holmwood, uses whistle for dogs, leads in rat incident

Edward Spencelagh.name: Edward Spencelagh
Edward Spencelagh.role: master mariner, murdered by pirates off the coast of Andres in 1854, mentioned on tombstone

Braithwaite Lowrey.name: Braithwaite Lowrey
Braithwaite Lowrey.role: deceased, lost in the Lively off Greenland in 1820, mentioned on tombstone

Andrew Woodhouse.name: Andrew Woodhouse
Andrew Woodhouse.role: deceased, drowned in Greenland seas in 1777, mentioned by Swales

John Paxton.name: John Paxton
John Paxton.role: deceased, drowned off Cape Farewell in 1778, mentioned by Swales

John Rawlings.name: John Rawlings
John Rawlings.role: deceased, drowned in the Gulf of Finland in 1850, mentioned by Swales

George Canon.name: George Canon
George Canon.role: deceased, suicide in 1873, mentioned on tombstone, hated his mother

Burdon-Sanderson.name: Burdon-Sanderson
Burdon-Sanderson.role: physiologist referenced by Seward in context of vivisection and science

Ferrier.name: Ferrier
Ferrier.role: scientist known for brain-knowledge, referenced by Seward

Abraham Van Helsing.name: Abraham Van Helsing
Abraham Van Helsing.role: professor and doctor treating Lucy, performs transfusions, provides garlic flowers for protection; Doctor, professor, vampire expert, friend of Seward and Godalming, investigates Lucy's death and related events

Ophelia.name: Ophelia
Ophelia.role: literary character from Shakespeare's Hamlet, referenced in Lucy's diary as a comparison to her own state with flowers

Thomas Bilder.name: Thomas Bilder
Thomas Bilder.role: keeper at the Zoological Gardens, interviewed about the escaped wolf Bersicker

Mrs. Bilder.name: Mrs. Bilder
Mrs. Bilder.role: wife of Thomas Bilder, hospitable, participates in the interview

Bersicker.name: Bersicker
Bersicker.role: escaped wolf from the zoo, interacts with mysterious man, returns on its own

Jamrach.name: Jamrach
Jamrach.role: animal dealer from whom the wolves were bought, referenced in the interview

Red Riding Hood.name: Red Riding Hood
Red Riding Hood.role: fairy tale character, referenced in comparison to the wolf's behavior

Patrick Hennessey.name: Patrick Hennessey
Patrick Hennessey.role: doctor reporting to Seward about Renfield and asylum conditions

Wilhelmina Harker.name: Wilhelmina Harker
Wilhelmina Harker.role: Wife of Jonathan, previously involved in compiling information, now excluded from the hunt, keeps journal, experiences dreams

Mary.name: Mary
Mary.role: Servant in the Harkers' home, opens the door for Van Helsing

Quincey Morris.name: Quincey Morris
Quincey Morris.role: American adventurer, part of the group hunting the Count, speaks in dialogues, follows clues

Renfield.name: Renfield
Renfield.role: Lunatic patient in Dr. Seward's asylum, connected to the Count, screams and prays, visited by characters

Charcot.name: Charcot
Charcot.role: Historical scientist referenced in discussion of hypnotism

Methuselah.name: Methuselah
Methuselah.role: Biblical figure referenced in discussion of longevity

Old Parr.name: Old Parr
Old Parr.role: Historical figure referenced in discussion of longevity

Byron.name: Byron
Byron.role: Poet referenced in context of proving uncomfortable truths and jealousy

Dr. Vincent.name: Dr. Vincent
Dr. Vincent.role: Doctor at the North Hospital, treats the injured child, friend of Van Helsing and Seward

Mr. Billington.name: Mr. Billington
Mr. Billington.role: Businessman in Whitby who handled the Count's shipments

Billington Junior.name: Billington Junior
Billington Junior.role: Son of Mr. Billington, assists Jonathan in inquiries in Whitby

Thomas Snelling.name: Thomas Snelling
Thomas Snelling.role: Carter involved in moving the Count's boxes, found drunk, assistant to Smollet

Joseph Smollet.name: Joseph Smollet
Joseph Smollet.role: Carter responsible for moving boxes from Carfax, provides information to Jonathan

Sam Bloxam.name: Sam Bloxam
Sam Bloxam.role: Worker who moved boxes for the Count to Piccadilly, provides details to Jonathan

Simmons.name: Simmons
Simmons.role: Attendant at the asylum, assists with Renfield and is sent away

Rufus Smith.name: Rufus Smith
Rufus Smith.role: Agent at Lloyd’s in London, sends telegrams about the ship

Hans Andersen.name: Hans Andersen
Hans Andersen.role: Author referenced for the Ugly Duckling story in Van Helsing's analogy

Max Nordau.name: Max Nordau
Max Nordau.role: Thinker referenced in discussion of criminal types

Cesare Lombroso.name: Cesare Lombroso
Cesare Lombroso.role: Criminologist referenced in discussion of criminal types

Archimedes.name: Archimedes
Archimedes.role: Ancient scientist referenced in Van Helsing's explanation of learning and fulcrum

Donelson.name: Donelson
Donelson.role: Captain of the Czarina Catherine, provides account of the voyage

Immanuel Hildesheim.name: Immanuel Hildesheim
Immanuel Hildesheim.role: Agent who received the box from the ship and handed it to Skinsky

Petrof Skinsky.name: Petrof Skinsky
Petrof Skinsky.role: Dealer who took the box, found dead with throat torn

Mr. de Ville.name: Mr. de Ville
Mr. de Ville.role: Sender of letter from London instructing Hildesheim, likely alias of Dracula

Mackenzie.name: Mackenzie
Mackenzie.role: One of the agents of the London firm Hapgood, assists the group

Steinkoff.name: Steinkoff
Steinkoff.role: One of the agents of the London firm Hapgood, assists the group
